run¶

Function run_test is defined in this file. You can run this file to get results of this example.

Author:
Yu-Ren Liu
run.run_test(task_name, layers, in_budget, max_step, repeat, terminal_value=None)[source]¶

example of running direct policy search for gym task.

Parameters:
  • task_name – gym task name
  • layers – layer information of the neural network e.g., [2, 5, 1] means input layer has 2 neurons, hidden layer(only one) has 5 and output layer has 1
  • in_budget – number of calls to the objective function
  • max_step – max step in gym
  • repeat – repeat number in a test
  • terminal_value – early stop, algorithm should stop when such value is reached
Returns:

no return value
run.run_test_handlingnoise(task_name, layers, in_budget, max_step, repeat, terminal_value)[source]¶

example of running direct policy search for gym task with noise handling.

Parameters:
  • task_name – gym task name
  • layers – layer information of the neural network e.g., [2, 5, 1] means input layer has 2 neurons, hidden layer(only one) has 5 and output layer has 1
  • in_budget – number of calls to the objective function
  • max_step – max step in gym
  • repeat – number of repeatitions for noise handling
  • terminal_value – early stop, algorithm should stop when such value is reached
Returns:

no return value
